name: Chole Masala Punjabi
steps: Soak chickpeas overnight
Pressure cook until tender
In a pan, temper cumin seeds in oil, add onions and sauté until golden
Add garlic and ginger; cook briefly
Stir in spices (turmeric, coriander, garam masala, red chili)
Add chopped tomatoes and simmer into a thick gravy
Add chickpeas and water; simmer until sauce coats chickpeas
Finish with amchur, salt to taste
Serve with bhature or rice

name: Sarson Da Saag with Makki Di Roti
steps: Wash greens thoroughly and chop
Boil or slow-cook greens with water till very tender; blend lightly to a coarse consistency
Temper ghee with cumin seeds, add onions, garlic, ginger, and chilies; sauté until fragrant
Mix in greens and simmer to thick consistency
Prepare makki di roti by kneading maize flour with warm water and salt, roll, and cook on tawa with a little ghee
Serve saag hot with roti and a dollop of ghee

name: Paneer Tikka Masala Punjabi Style
steps: Marinate paneer cubes in yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, and spices for 20-30 minutes
Griddled or pan-fry until lightly charred
In a separate pan, sauté onions until translucent, add tomato puree and cook into a rich gravy with spices
Stir in cream and fenugreek leaves
Add paneer to sauce and simmer briefly
Adjust salt

name: Sarson da Saag with Makki di Roti
steps: Wash greens thoroughly
Cook greens with a pinch of salt until wilted
Grind a portion of greens with garlic and ginger to form a coarse paste
Temper cumin seeds in ghee, add chopped onions, sauté until translucent
Add ground greens paste, turmeric, and salt; simmer on low heat for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally
Serve with mashed greens on makki di roti; finish with a dollop of ghee

name: Chole with Amritsari Kulcha
steps: Soak chickpeas overnight and cook until tender
Prepare masala by sautéing onions in ghee, add ginger-garlic paste, spices, and tomatoes; cook until oil separates
Add chickpeas and water; simmer until thick
Crush kasuri methi and stir in
Bake/roast kulchas until blistered; brush with ghee before serving

name: Butter Paneer Punjabi Style
steps: Sauté onions in butter until golden
Add ginger-garlic paste and spices, then tomatoes; cook until oil separate
Stir in paneer cubes lightly fried, add cream, simmer for 5–7 minutes
Finish with kasuri methi and fresh coriander

name: Sarson da Saag (Step-by-step) with Makki di Roti
ingredients: maize flour (makki ka atta) for roti
steps: Wash and chop greens
Boil a portion with water and salt until tender; blend some greens with garlic, ginger, and chilies
Temper ghee with cumin seeds, add chopped onions until translucent, mix in blended greens and boiled greens, simmer slowly
Prepare rotis using makki flour with hot water and a pinch of salt; cook on tawa until lightly charred
Serve saag hot with a dollop of ghee and roti

name: Gajar Halwa (Punjabi-style Carrot Pudding)
steps: Cook grated carrots in ghee until soft
Add milk and sugar; simmer until thick and glossy
Stir in cardamom powder, garnish with chopped nuts
Serve warm or room temperature

name: Sarson da Saag with Makki di Roti
steps: Wash and boil mustard greens and spinach
Prepare a tempered blend of cumin seeds, garlic, ginger, and green chilies in ghee
Add greens, simmer until thick
In a separate pot, make dough from makki ka atta with warm water and roll into flat rotis
Serve saag with hot makki di roti, topped with a dollop of ghee

name: Chole Punjabi (Chickpea Curry)
steps: Soak chickpeas overnight, cook until tender
In a pan, temper with cumin seeds, bay leaf, and whole spices
Add onions; sauté until golden
Stir in ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and spices
Add chickpeas and water; simmer until oil separates
Finish with garam masala and amchur

name: Butter Chicken Punjabi Style
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic, and spices
Sear chicken in butter, set aside
In same pan, make a rich gravy with butter, tomato puree, cream, and spices
Return chicken and simmer until tender
Finish with kasuri methi and a drizzle of butter

name: Sarson da Saag (Mustard Greens) with Paneer Dumplings
steps: Cook greens with water until soft, blend with minimal water
Prepare a tempering with garlic, ginger, and chilies in ghee; add greens
Make paneer dumplings by mixing paneer, cornmeal, and salt, shaping into small dumplings, simmer in curry until cooked
Finish with a pat of butter

name: Paneer Tikka Masala Punjabi Version
steps: Marinate paneer in yogurt with ginger-garlic paste and spices; grill or pan-sear until golden
Prepare a rich masala with onion, tomato, cream and spices
Add paneer to gravy and simmer gently
Finish with butter and crushed kasuri methi

name: Butter Chicken (Murgh Makhani)
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt, garlic, and ginger
Sear in butter with spices
Simmer in tomato-cream gravy with kasuri methi
Finish with a pat of butter and cream
Serve with naan or steamed rice

name: Sarson da Saag with Makki di Roti
steps: Wash greens and simmer slowly with garlic, ginger, and green chilies
Temper with cumin seeds in ghee
Serve saag with hot makki di roti and a dollop of butter

name: Chole (Punjabi Chickpea Curry)
steps: Soak and pressure-cook chickpeas
Prepare masala with onions and tomatoes; add spices
Combine with chickpeas and simmer
Finish with a splash of tea for depth

name: Paneer Tikka Masala
steps: Marinate paneer in yogurt and spices; grill or pan-sear
Prepare creamy tomato gravy with spices, then add paneer and simmer
Finish with butter and cream

name: Amritsari Fish Curry
steps: Coat fish with spiced besan and shallow-fry
Prepare a tangy curry with yogurt, tomato, and spices
Return fish to curry to finish cooking; drizzle with mustard oil for authenticity

name: Sarson da Saag with Makki di Roti
steps: Wash greens thoroughly
Chop greens and cook slowly with onions, tomatoes, garlic, ginger, and green chilies in mustard oil until soft
Grind a portion of greens into a coarse paste and return to pot to thicken
Temper with a tadka of cumin seeds, chili, and a pinch of asafoetida in ghee
Serve with freshly made makki di roti and a dollop of butter

name: Chole Bhature
steps: Soak chickpeas overnight and cook till tender
Prepare a rich masala with onions, tomatoes, and spices
Add chickpeas and simmer to coat
Deep-fry dough for bhature until puffed and golden
Serve hot with chole

name: Paneer Tikka Masala (Punjabi Style)
steps: Marinate paneer in spiced yogurt and shallow fry
Prepare a rich tomato-based gravy with spices and cream
Simmer paneer in gravy until flavors meld
Finish with a pat of butter

name: Aloo Gobhi (Punjabi Style)
steps: Sauté cumin seeds in hot oil, add onions until translucent
Add ginger-garlic paste, then potatoes and cauliflower
Add tomatoes and spices, cover and cook slowly until tender

name: Khushka with Melted Butter (Punjabi Rice)
steps: Rinse rice and parboil with whole spices
Drain, steam-fy with minimal water and finish with a drizzle of melted butter and a pinch of salt

name: Rajma Masala (Punjabi Kidney Bean Curry)
steps: Soak beans overnight and pressure-cook until soft
Prepare a rich masala with onions and tomatoes, add spices, simmering until thick
Fold in beans and simmer to blend flavors

name: Dal Makhani (Punjabi Black Lentil)
ingredients: rajma is kidney beans so ignore
steps: Soak urad dal and red kidney beans overnight
Cook until soft with water
In another pan, prepare a rich tempering with ghee, spices, and tomatoes
Combine with dal and simmer on low for hours
Finish with cream and a pat of butter

name: Classic Masala Dada Style Avial
steps: Slice vegetables uniformly
Toast curry leaves, mustard seeds, and cumin in coconut oil
Add turmeric, then vegetables, a splash of water, and simmer until tender
Finish with grated coconut and safflower oil tempering
Serve with hot steamed rice and papad

name: Podi Masala Lemon Rice
steps: Cook rice and spread to cool
Roast and grind urad dal, chana dal, dried red chilies into a coarse podi
Temper with sesame oil, mustard seeds, curry leaves
Mix podi with rice, add lemon juice and salt, toss well

name: Kerala Parippu Curry with Coconut
steps: Pressure-cook toor dal until soft
Grind coconut, green chilies, cumin into a paste
Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves in coconut oil, add garlic
Combine with dal, simmer with turmeric until flavorful

name: Coconut Milk Puttu with Sugar Banana
steps: Steam rice flour with salt to make puttu flour
Layer with fresh coconut in a cylindrical puttu steamer and steam until fluffy
Serve with ripe banana or sugar banana and a drizzle of ghee

name: Masala Dosa with Potato Filling
steps: Soak rice and urad dal with fenugreek seeds, grind to a fine batter, ferment overnight
Prepare potato masala with mustard seeds, curry leaves, turmeric and onions
Heat a skillet, spread batter thin for dosa, cook until crisp, add potato filling, fold and serve after a brief crisping
Serve with coconut chutney and sambar

name: Sundal (Chickpea Stir-Fry)
steps: Soak chickpeas until tender
Temper mustard seeds in oil with curry leaves and green chiles, add chickpeas, toss with salt and a squeeze of lemon, finish with fresh grated coconut

name: Puliyodarai (Tamarind Rice)
steps: Cook rice and let cool
Prepare tamarind paste with spices in oil, temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves and sesame/peanuts
Fold tamarind mixture into rice, mix gently and let flavors blend

name: Avial (Outer Vegetables with Coconut)
steps: Chop vegetables into uniform pieces and steam until tender
Grind coconut with green chilies and cumin
Mix veggies with coconut paste, add curry leaves and a drizzle of coconut oil, optional yogurt to finish
Simmer briefly to combine flavors

name: Rasam (Tamarind-Spice Soup)
steps: Cook tomatoes and tamarind with water to a tangy base
Temper with mustard seeds, cumin, pepper, curry leaves, garlic in ghee/oil
Add simmered dal if desired, finish with coriander leaves

name: Bisi Bele Bath
steps: Rinse rice and toor dal and cook until soft
Prepare a masala by grinding coriander seeds, coconut, red chilies, and sesame seeds
Temper mustard, cumin, curry leaves in oil, add chopped vegetables, spices, and cooked dal mix
Combine with cooked rice and tamarind-jaggery paste; simmer until flavors meld
Serve with fried papad or mango pickle

name: Idli with Sambar
steps: Soak and grind rice and urad dal separately with fenugreek; ferment batter
Steam idlis until fluffy
For sambar, simmer toor dal with tamarind water, sambar powder, and vegetables; temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil

name: Rava Kesari with Coconut
steps: Roast rava lightly in ghee until fragrant
Add hot water and cook to a soft, fluffy consistency
Sweeten with sugar and a pinch of saffron; finish with cardamom and roasted cashews and grated coconut

name: Coconut Chutney for Idli/Dosa
steps: Grind coconut, chana dal, chilies, tamarind with a little water into a smooth paste
Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil and mix into chutney

name: Puttu with Kadala Curry
steps: Steam layers of rice flour mixed with grated coconut to make puttu
Prepare curry by cooking soaked kadala with onions, curry leaves, fennel, and spices; simmer with coconut milk
Layer puttu with kadala curry

name: Mangalorean Fish Curry (Meen Curry)
steps: Temper mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil
Sauté chopped onions and garlic until translucent
Add spices (coriander, red chili, turmeric, fenugreek) and sauté briefly
Pour in tamarind pulp and coconut milk, simmer with fish pieces until cooked
Finish with salt to taste and garnish with fresh cilantro

name: Masala Dosa with Potato Masala (Sadya Style)
steps: Prepare dosa batter and let ferment
Cook thin crepes on a hot tawa with a little oil
For the potato masala, sauté mustard seeds and curry leaves, add onions, green chilis, turmeric, salt, then add boiled potatoes and mash slightly with spices
Fill dosa with masala and fold
Serve with coconut chutney and sambar

name: Hyderabadi Bagara Baingan (Spiced Eggplant)
steps: Roast and grind peanuts, sesame, and coconut to a coarse paste
Temper mustard seeds in oil with curry leaves and chopped onions
Add ground paste, tamarind, and spices; simmer until oil separates
Add fried eggplants and simmer to finish
Garnish with fresh coriander

name: Avial (Mixed Vegetable Coconut Curry)
steps: Grind fresh coconut with green chilies and cumin to a coarse paste
Boil assorted vegetables until just tender, then combine with the coconut paste and a little yogurt if using
Temper mustard seeds in oil and add curry leaves, pour over curry
Simmer briefly to meld flavors

name: Rasam (Tamarind Soup) with Lentils
ingredients: pigeon peas (toor dal) or masoor dal
steps: Cook lentils with tamarind water, tomatoes and spices until soft
Temper with mustard seeds, cumin, garlic, curry leaves and asafoetida in hot oil
Pour tempering over the dal, simmer briefly to combine

name: Masala Dosa with Potato Filling
steps: Soak rice and urad dal with fenugreek; grind to a smooth batter and ferment
Prepare potato masala with mustard seeds, curry leaves, onions, turmeric
Heat a seasoned tawa, pour batter to form thin crepe, cook till crisp, stuff with potato masala, serve with coconut chutney and sambar

name: Ragi Mudde with Sambar
steps: Boil water, slowly stir in ragi flour to form a stiff mudde; simmer until fully cooked
Prepare sambar with toor dal and vegetables, temper with mustard seeds and curry leaves

name: Curd Rice (Yogurt Rice) with Tempered Mustard
steps: Mix cooled rice with whisked curd, add salt
Heat oil, temper with mustard seeds, urad dal, curry leaves and green chilies; pour over curd rice and mix

name: Lemon Rice (Chitranna) with Papad
steps: Tempered mustard seeds and curry leaves in oil, add peanuts until roasted
Stir in turmeric, lemon juice, salt, and fold into rice

name: Avial (Vegetable Medley)
steps: Cook vegetables with coconut in a seasoned pan, grind coconut with cumin and green chilies; add to vegetables with a hint of curd and coconut oil, finish with curry leaves

name: Medu Vada with Sambar
steps: Soak and grind urad dal to a fluffy batter, add seasoning and shape into doughnut forms
Deep-fry until crisp
Serve with hot sambar and coconut chutney

name: Shukto Bhorta
steps: Peel and slice vegetables (banana, potato, taro, brinjal)
Boil until tender
Grind poppy seeds, mustard seeds, turmeric with a little water to a paste
Temper with mustard oil in a pan, add chopped green chilies and powdered spices
Fold in boiled vegetables, mash lightly and simmer to blend flavors
Finish with a drizzle of mustard oil and a pinch of salt
Serve with steamed rice

name: Cholar Dal with Baked Rasgulla Garnish
steps: Soak chana dal and simmer until soft but intact
Prepare a jaggery-tomato-topping by heating jaggery with a splash of water and coconut
Temper with bay leaf, cinnamon, cardamom in ghee
Add dal and reduce to a thick consistency
Garnish with a small piece of rasgulla dusted with coconut before serving

name: Chingri Maacher Jhol (Prawn Curry)
steps: Marinate prawns with turmeric and salt
Grind mustard seeds and cumin into a paste
Temper with mustard oil, garlic, ginger, onions until translucent
Add chili paste and tomatoes; simmer to form a sauce
Add prawns and cook until pink; finish with coriander

name: Begun Bharta with Posta (Smoky Eggplant Mash with Poppy Seeds)
steps: Roast eggplants until charred and soft, scoop out flesh
Dry roast poppy seeds and grind into paste
Sauté onions and garlic in mustard oil until golden
Add eggplant flesh, spices, and poppy paste; mash to creamy texture
Finish with chopped coriander

name: Moong Daler Payesh (Rice Pudding with Green Gram Dal)
steps: Rinse dal and rice, soak briefly
Boil with milk until creamy; add sugar and cardamom
Simmer slowly, stirring to prevent sticking
Finish with saffron, ghee drizzle and chopped nuts

name: Posto Maach (Bangla Prawn with Popcorn)
steps: Clean prawns
Temper mustard seeds in mustard oil until they crackle
Add grated garlic and ginger, green chilies, and turmeric; sauté briefly
Add prawns and cook until pink
Prepare a light poppy seed paste by grinding khuskhus with a splash of water and stir into the pan
Finish with a pinch of salt and a quick toss in rice flour to thicken slightly
Serve with steamed rice and a side of fried potatoes

name: Chingri Malai Curry
steps: Lightly sauté chopped onions in hot mustard oil until translucent
Add garlic, ginger, and green chilies; cook until fragrant
Stir in turmeric and cumin seeds
Add prawns and splash of water; simmer briefly
Pour in coconut milk and simmer until prawns are cooked through
Finish with garam masala and chopped coriander

name: Aloo Posto (Potato with Poppy Seeds)
steps: Boil and cube potatoes
Grind khuskhus with a little water to make a paste
Heat mustard oil, temper kalonji, add chopped onion, garlic, and ginger; sauté until golden
Add potatoes, turmeric, salt, and a little water; cover and simmer
Stir in poppy seed paste and cook until potatoes are tender and coating thickens

name: Chorchori (Bengal Mixed Vegetables)
steps: Heat mustard oil until smoking point; lower flame
Add panch phoron and black seeds; let pop
Add chopped vegetables in batches, starting with sturdier ones
Sprinkle turmeric and salt; stir-fry until vegetables are half-cooked
Finish with a splash of water and simmer until vegetables are tender and oil separates
Serve over warm rice

name: Shorshe Ilish (Hilsa in Mustard Sauce)
steps: Marinate hilsa with turmeric and salt briefly
Grind mustard seeds with a little water to a smooth paste
Heat mustard oil until smoking, add kalonji; quickly add the fish pieces and sear lightly
Add mustard paste and chopped green chilies; add a splash of water and simmer gently until fish is cooked through, taking care not to overcook
Adjust salt

name: Shorshe Begun (Mustard Eggplant)
steps: Slice brinjal into thick rounds
Temper mustard seeds and nigella seeds in hot oil until fragrant
Add turmeric, chili powder and ground poppy seeds mixed with a little water to make a paste; simmer to form a rich gravy
Layer fried eggplants in the pan, gently coat with the masala, cover and simmer on low heat until eggplants absorb flavors
Finish with a touch of salt and a drizzle of coconut oil
Serve with steamed rice

name: Dal Bhat Shorshe (Lentils with Mustard Sauce)
steps: Cook lentils with turmeric until soft
In a separate pan temper mustard seeds and nigella seeds in ghee with minced garlic and ginger; add ground spices and a splash of water to form a fragrant tadka
Pour tadka over cooked lentils, simmer 5-7 minutes to meld flavors
Finish with a spoon of mustard paste for depth

name: Machhher Jhol (Light Fish Curry)
steps: Heat mustard oil until smoking point, then cool slightly
Temper panch phoron, add chopped onions and garlic, cook until translucent
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, and salt; simmer to form a thin gravy
Add fish pieces, cover, and simmer gently until fish is cooked through
Finish with chopped coriander

name: Chingri Malai Curry (Prawns in Coconut Cream)
steps: Sauté onions, garlic, ginger and green chilies in mustard oil until golden
Add spices and a splash of water; stir to release aromas
Pour in coconut milk and simmer briefly
Add prawns and cook until they curl and turn opaque
Finish with a touch of garam masala and salt to taste

name: Aloo Posto (Potatoes in Poppy Seed Paste)
steps: Grind poppy seeds with green chili into a fine paste
Fry finely chopped onions in hot oil until translucent
Add turmeric and potatoes, toss to coat
Stir in poppy seed paste with a splash of water; cover and cook on low heat until potatoes are tender
Salt to taste and finish with a light drizzle of oil

name: Shorshe Ilish
steps: Grind mustard seeds and poppy seeds with a little water to make a coarse paste
Temper hot mustard oil with nigella seeds and chopped onions until translucent
Add turmeric and salt, then the fish gently
Add the mustard-poppy paste and simmer on low heat, avoiding overpowering the fish
Finish with a splash of water if needed and cook until the fish is just done
Serve with steamed rice

name: Chingri Malai Curry
steps: Sauté cumin seeds and chopped onions in mustard oil until golden
Add garlic and ginger paste, followed by turmeric and garam masala
Stir in prawns and cook briefly
Pour in thick coconut milk and simmer gently until prawns are cooked and the sauce thickens
Garnish with coriander leaves and a drizzle of mustard oil

name: Aloo Posto
steps: Grind poppy seeds with a little water to form a smooth paste
Fry cumin and nigella seeds in hot mustard oil, add chopped onions and green chilies
Add potatoes and toss
Stir in posto paste, salt, and enough water to barely cover
Simmer until potatoes are tender and the sauce coats well

name: Doi Maach
ingredients: Fish fillets (tlying fish or any white fish)
steps: Marinate fish in turmeric, salt, and a touch of sugar
Fry lightly in mustard oil and set aside
In the same pan, temper with ginger and garlic paste, add cumin powder and garam masala, then whisk in yogurt to make a thick sauce
Return fish to the pan, simmer gently until flavors meld and sauce coats the fish

name: Bhapa Chingri
steps: Blend yogurt, grated coconut, poppy seeds, green chilies, and ginger into a smooth paste
Layer prawns in a steaming dish, pour the paste over, drizzle with mustard oil, and scatter mustard seeds and cashews on top
Steam until prawns are cooked and the flavors meld

name: Shorshe Maach (Mustard Fish)
steps: Wash fish and marinate with salt and turmeric
Grind mustard seeds and poppy seeds with a little water to a paste
Heat mustard oil until smoking point, temper with nigella seeds and green chilies
Add fish and spoon the mustard-poppy seed paste, cook on low heat until fish is tender, finish with a splash of warm water if needed
Serve with steamed rice

name: Aloo Posto (Potato with Poppy Seeds)
steps: Soak poppy seeds and grind into a paste with green chilies
Cut potatoes into cubes and parboil
Temper hot mustard oil with nigella seeds, add onions if using, then add potatoes and the poppy seed paste
Stir, season with turmeric and salt, cook until potatoes are tender and coated with paste

name: Chingri Malai Curry (Prawn Coconut Curry)
steps: Sauté chopped onions in hot mustard oil until translucent
Add garlic, ginger and green chilies; fry briefly
Add prawns and spices, then pour coconut milk
Simmer until prawns are cooked and the sauce thickens
Finish with a touch of warm water if needed

name: Kosha Mangsho (Bengali Mutton Curry)
steps: Marinate mutton with turmeric and salt
Sauté onions in hot mustard oil until deep brown
Add ginger-garlic paste, then tomatoes and ground spices; cook until oil floats
Add mutton with a little water; slow-cook until tender and thick gravy coats the meat
Finish with garam masala

name: Begun Bhorta (Smoked Eggplant Mash)
steps: Smoke or roast whole eggplants until charred and soft
Scoop out pulp and mash with mustard oil, chopped onions, chilies, and salt
Adjust acidity with lemon juice; garnish with coriander

name: Undhiyu (Winter Mixed Vegetable Stew)
steps: Wash and trim vegetables; prepare a batter of fresh coconut, peanuts, sesame seeds, coriander, cumin, and green chilies
Temper mustard seeds in oil, add curry leaves, and stir in the ground spice paste
Add yams and potatoes, cover and simmer on low heat; add the Surti papdi and fenugreek leaves near the end
Finish with a splash of lemon juice and fresh coriander
Traditionally cooked in a matka or clay pot, then finished on a low flame while the masala soaks into the vegetables

name: Dhokli Nu Shaak (Gujarati Dumplings in Curry)
steps: Knead flour with water to make firm dough, roll into thick sheets and cut into small diamond shapes
Parboil in salted water until half-cooked
Prepare a tempering with mustard seeds and curry leaves, add spices and water to make a curry
Add dumplings and simmer until they absorb the flavors and thicken the sauce

name: Ringan no Olo (Smoky Eggplant in Garlic-Ten-Tempered Sauce)
steps: Roast eggplants until charred and soft
Blend garlic, peanuts, sesame oil, coriander, cumin, turmeric, jaggery, and tamarind with a splash of water to create a smoky paste
Fry the paste lightly, then add roasted eggplants and simmer until flavors meld
Finish with a drizzle of oil and fresh cilantro

name: Khandvi (Savory Gram Flour Rolls)
steps: Whisk yogurt with besan, turmeric, and water until smooth
Cook on low heat while stirring to a thick batter
Spread thinly on a greased flat surface, roll tightly, slice, and temper with sesame seeds and mustard seeds in hot oil
Garnish with curry leaves and lemon juice before serving

name: Thepla with Fresh Fermented Garlic Pickle (Thepla and Garlic Pickle)
steps: Knead flour with yogurt, water, and chopped methi to a soft dough
Roll into thin flatbreads, roast on a tawa with oil until crisp
Serve hot with fresh garlic pickle and a wedge of lemon

name: Undhiyu with Surti Lilva
steps: Prepare stuffing by grinding coriander seeds, cumin seeds, sesame seeds, peanuts into coarse powder
Temper mustard seeds in hot oil, add curry leaves, garlic and ginger until fragrant
Mix ground spice paste with chutney-like masala and toss vegetables with masala
Add water just to cover; simmer slowly until lilva and surti val are tender and flavors meld
Finish with a squeeze of lemon and chopped cilantro
Serve with puri or bhakri

name: Ringan Nooro Rotlo (Eggplant and Whole Wheat Flatbread)
steps: Roast brinjal over flame until charred and soft, scoop flesh and mix with crushed garlic, green chilies, cumin seeds, coriander leaves
Knead atta with water and a pinch of salt into a smooth dough; rest
Roll dough into flatbreads; brush with sesame oil and toast on a tawa until brown
Stuffed brinjal mixture tucked into dough and cooked till crisp on edges
Finish with a drizzle of lemon juice and chopped cilantro

name: Gujarati Kadhi with Arhar Dal
steps: Whisk yogurt with besan and water to make a smooth kadhi base
Temper with mustard, cumin, fenugreek, asafoetida in hot oil; add curry leaves
Pour into kadhi and simmer gently until thick
Add cooked arhar dal and simmer a few minutes; season with sugar and salt
Garnish with cilantro

name: Daal Dodhiyu (Gujarati Lentil Stew with Muthiya)
steps: Cook dal with turmeric until soft
Parmasine tempered spices in oil; add chopped fenugreek seeds and curry leaves
Add chopped gourd and simmer until tender
Mix besan with water to make a slurry; stir into dal to thicken
Add jaggery and lemon juice; finish with cilantro

name: Besan Chilla with Spinach and Methi Thepla
steps: Mix besan with chopped spinach, methi, finely minced ginger and garlic, and spices to form a batter
Heat a tava; coat with a little oil
Pour batter to form thin pancakes; cook both sides until golden
Fold with a few fresh cilantro leaves for aroma

name: Undhiyu with Surti Papdi and Surti Lilva
steps: Prepare muthia by mixing grated jaggery, jaggery, gram flour, chopped cilantro, green garlic, sesame, coriander seeds, and spices; steam until firm
Temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, garlic, and green chilies in oil
Add mashed tamarind, jaggery, and spice mix to create tangy-sweet masala
Layer Surti papdi, Surti lilva, and methi muthia in a deep pot; pour masala and water; cover and cook on low heat until tender, occasionally turning to prevent sticking
Finish with a fenugreek-garlic temper and serve hot with puri or bhakri

name: Dhokli Nu Shaak (Gujarati Wheat Vermicelli Stew)
steps: Knead a dough with whole-wheat flour and chickpea flour; roll into thin sheets and cut into diamond shapes
Prepare a tempering with cumin, mustard seeds, asafoetida, curry leaves; add garlic and ginger paste
Add chopped tomatoes, turmeric, coriander powder, tamarind pulp and jaggery to create tangy-sweet gravy
Simmer dough diamonds in the gravy until cooked and slightly thickened
Finish with fresh cilantro and a squeeze of lemon if desired

name: Handvo (Savory lentil-vegetable cake)
steps: Soak and grind tuvar and rice; mix with grated doodhi, chopped spinach, sesame, peanuts, chopped chilies, ginger, garlic
Ferment mixture overnight to activate leavening; temper with cumin, mustard seeds, sesame oil, and asafoetida
Pour into a seasoned pan and bake or steam until a firm loaf forms with a browned crust
Slice and serve with garlic chutney

name: Khandvi with Fresh Cilantro-Tennu Chutney
steps: Whisk besan and yogurt with water until smooth; simmer to form thick batter with turmeric and sugar
Spread thin on a flat plate and roll into tight cylinders after slightly cooling
Temper mustard seeds and sesame seeds in oil; pour over rolled batter and let set
Slice into bite-sized discs and serve with cilantro chutney

name: Ringan No Olo (Baingan Bharta Gujarati Style)
steps: Roast eggplants over flame until charred; scoop out flesh
Temper spices in oil; add garlic, ginger, green chilies, and powder spices
Stir in eggplant flesh with a splash of water; simmer to meld flavors
Finish with lemon juice and chopped cilantro

name: Undhiyu
steps: Wash and chop vegetables
Prepare a masala by grinding fresh coriander seeds, cumin, sesame, and peanuts
Temper mustard seeds in sesame oil, add curry leaves, then add ground masala and jaggery; simmer to create a thick masala
Add vegetables, cover and slow-cook until tender, occasionally adding water
Finish with chopped cilantro and a squeeze of lemon

name: Dhokli nu Shaak
steps: Cook dal with turmeric and salt until soft
Roll-out small dough shapes (dhokli) from the dough, drop into simmering dal with a pinch of salt
Temper mustard seeds, garlic, chilies in ghee; pour over dal-dhokli once the dhokli is cooked; simmer for a few more minutes
Add jaggery for subtle sweetness
Finish with coriander leaves

name: Ringan no Olo (Baingan Bharta Gujarati Style)
steps: Roast brinjal over direct flame or bake until charred and soft
Peel and mash
Temper sesame oil with mustard seeds, garlic, and green chilies; add spices and mashed brinjal, sauté briefly
Finish with lemon juice and chopped coriander

name: Fafda with Jalebi (Gujarati Snack-Style)
steps: Prepare dough for fafda by mixing besan with spices and water to make a stiff batter; roll into thin strips and deep-fry until crisp
Prepare jalebi batter and deep-fry spirals in hot oil; soak in sugar syrup
Serve fafda with a few slices of raw onion and a tangy chutney, alongside jalebi as a sweet pairing

name: Gujarati Kadhi with Besan Daal Dal
steps: Whisk yogurt with besan and water to a smooth consistency
In a pot, temper mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, green chilies
Add the yogurt-besan mixture and cook on low heat, stirring constantly to prevent curdling; simmer until slightly thick
Add jaggery if desired for a touch of sweetness
Garnish with cilantro

name: Undhiyu with Farm-fresh Vegetables
steps: Oops

name: Undhiyu with Surti Papdi and Kanda Lilva
steps: Prepare spice paste by grinding fresh coriander seeds, cumin seeds, garlic, ginger, green chili, and fresh cilantro
Temper mustard seeds in hot oil, add curry leaves and asafetida
Mix in ground paste, then fold in boiled surti papdi, purple yam, and lilva
Layer with stuffed eggplants (bhavnagari), drizzle with sesame-peanut chutney, cook slowly in heavy-bottomed pot with a traditional mat (tali) to trap heat
Finish with grated fresh coconut and jaggery
Serve with puri or bhakri

name: Doodhpak with Jaggery and Cardamom
steps: Boil milk and simmer until reduced
In a separate pan, paste jaggery with a little milk and add to the thickening milk
Stir in rice flour or sooji to thicken
Add cardamom and saffron
Finish with a dusting of nuts and a knob of ghee
Simmer gently until the mixture forms a soft, creamy pudding
Cool slightly before serving

name: Ringan no Olo (Eggplant Stew) with Fresh Garlic-Tamarind Chutney
steps: Roast whole eggplants over direct flame until charred and soft
Peel and mash with chopped garlic and tamarind chutney
Prepare a tempering with mustard seeds and sesame seeds; add masala powders and reduce
Combine with mashed eggplant and simmer until flavors meld
Finish with chopped cilantro and peanuts
Serve with bajra rotla

name: Khandvi Gujarati Rolls
steps: Whisk yogurt with besan, water, turmeric, and salt to a lump-free batter
Cook on low heat until thick
Spread thinly on a flat greased surface to roll once cooled slightly
Sprinkle sesame seeds and coriander leaves, roll tightly, and slice into bite-sized pieces
Temper seeds in hot oil and drizzle over the rolls

name: Dal Baati Churma
ingredients: split pigeon peas (tuvar dal) or toor dal
churma (crushed baati with jaggery or sugar)
steps: Prepare dal: temper cumin seeds in hot ghee, add garlic, green chilies, turmeric, asafoetida; add dal with water and simmer until creamy
Prepare baati: knead wheat flour with ghee, salt and water into stiff dough, shape into balls, bake in clay oven or oven until crisp and dry
Crush baati and mix with ghee and jaggery/sugar to make churma; serve alongside dal with extra ghee
Serve dal in bowls with hot baati and churma on the side

name: Gatte ki Sabzi
steps: Make a stiff dough from besan and water, shape into cylinders, steam until cooked and firm
Slice into rounds and shallow-fry until golden
Prepare yogurt-based gravy with tempering of mustard seeds, cumin, garlic, ginger, green chilies; add turmeric, coriander powder and red chili; simmer
Add gatte and simmer to coat with gravy

name: Laal Maas (Rajasthani Red Meat Curry)
steps: Marinate meat in yogurt, garlic, ginger, red chili paste and spices for several hours
Temper whole spices in hot ghee, add onions and sauté until deep golden
Add marinated meat and cook on high heat to seal, then simmer with water or stock until tender
Adjust seasoning and thicken gravy as needed

name: Pyaaz Ki Kachori with Mirchi Kadhi
steps: Prepare dough with flour, semolina, salt and water; rest
Make filling with finely chopped onions, green chilies and spices
Stuff dough rounds and deep-fry until crisp
For kadhi, whisk yogurt with chickpea flour and spices; simmer until slightly thickened; temper with cumin and mustard seeds

name: Kesar Mochai Subzi (Palette of Seasonal Beans)
ingredients: fresh or dried moong beans or banan ki phali
steps: Soak and simmer beans until tender
Prepare a spiced gravy using besan and spices fried in ghee
Add beans and saffron-infused milk; simmer to blend flavors
Finish with fresh coriander

name: Dal Baati Churma
steps: Soak dal with turmeric and salt; pressure cook until soft
Knead dough with wheat flour, semolina, salt, and ghee; shape into small balls and bake until golden (baati)
Grind roasted coriander seeds, cumin, red chilies, and fennel; temper with ghee, then add dal, simmer to blend
Mix crushed baatis with ghee and jaggery to make churma; crumble and mix with cardamom
Serve dal with hot baati and churma on the side

name: Laal Maans (Red Meat Curry)
steps: Clean meat and marinate with yogurt, turmeric, and salt for 30 minutes
Heat ghee; temper with cumin and crushed red chilies
Add finely chopped onions, brown them; add ginger-garlic paste
Add spices and tomatoes; cook until oil separates
Return meat, add water; slow-cook until tender
Finish with a dollop of ghee and serve

name: Gatte ki Sabzi (Besan Dumplings Curry)
steps: Mix besan with yogurt, spices, and a little water to make a thick batter; steam into cylinders and cut into round gatte
Fry gatte lightly or simmer in water
Prepare base gravy with onion-tomato paste, ginger-garlic, and spices; add water to desired consistency
Add gatte; simmer to absorb flavors
Finish with a splash of ghee

name: Bajre ki Roti with Lehsun Chutney
steps: Knead bajra flour with warm water and salt; shape into flat rounds and cook on a hot griddle with a little ghee
Grind garlic, green chilies, roasted chana dal into a coarse chutney; mix with salt and lemon juice
Serve roti hot with generous chutney on the side
Optional: drizzle more ghee before serving

name: Khuska Bharta (Smoked Eggplant Mash)
steps: Char the eggplant over direct flame until skin is blackened and flesh is soft
Peel skin; mash the flesh
Sauté onions in oil; add garlic, tomatoes and spices; cook until oil separates
Fold in mashed eggplant; simmer 5-7 minutes
Garnish with fresh coriander and a drizzle of ghee

name: Dal Batti Churma
steps: Prepare batti by kneading gram flour with water, salt and ghee; form into dough balls and slow-cook in a clay oven or low flame until firm
Cook dal with turmeric, cumin, coriander, garlic, and asafetida until creamy
Serve dal with crumbled churma mixed with ghee; offer batti with dal and churma layered together for dipping

name: Gatte ki Sabzi
steps: Make dough from gram flour with water and salt then cut into cylinders and steam until firm
Slice gatte and simmer in a tangy yogurt-based curry seasoned with tempering of mustard and cumin seeds, garlic, ginger and spices

name: Laal Maas
steps: Marinate mutton in yogurt, red chili paste and spices; sear in hot ghee, then simmer with water or stock until tender
Finish with a tempering of whole spices and garlic-ginger paste

name: Bajre ki Roti with Lehsun Chutney
steps: Knead bajra flour with warm water and a pinch of salt to form a soft dough; flatten into discs and cook on a hot tava or tawa until crisp-edged
Prepare chutney by grinding garlic, green chilies, salt with a light tempering of mustard and sesame seeds in oil

name: Ker Sangri
steps: Soak ker and sangri to rehydrate, then simmer with onions, garlic and a tempering of cumin, coriander and mustard seeds
Finish with amchur and a touch of oil for gloss

name: Gatte ki Sabzi
steps: Make dough from besan with spices
Shape into gram flour dumplings and steam
Temper with mustard, cumin, garlic-ginger in ghee
Add yogurt and simmer with gatte until tender
Garnish with sesame seeds and coriander

name: Laadkiya Dal
steps: Pressure-cook dal with turmeric
Prepare tadka with cumin seeds, garlic, ginger in ghee
Add tomatoes and spices, simmer until thick
Fold dal and simmer 5 minutes

name: Ker Sangri Sabzi
steps: Soak ker sangri to soften
Temper with mustard and cumin seeds in oil
Add garlic and spices, then ker sangri and a splash of water
Cook slowly until berry and beans absorb flavors

name: Pyaaz ki Kachori (Rajasthani Onion Stuffed Pastry)
steps: Prepare dough with flour and semolina
Make onion filling with spiced sautéed onions
Stuff dough and seal edges
Deep-fry or shallow-fry until golden
Serve warm with coriander chutney

name: Elchi Ki Subzi (Green Chili and Coriander Relish with Vegetables)
steps: Coarsely grind cilantro and green chilies with spices
Temper seeds in oil
Stir in chopped vegetables and cook until tender
Finish with herb-chili paste
Simmer 5-7 minutes

name: Dal Baati Churma
steps: Prepare dal by boiling moong/toor dal with salt and turmeric
Temper ghee with cumin, garlic, asafoetida, coriander powder
Cook dal until thick and flavorful
Bake or slow-roast dough balls into baati until crisp outside and soft inside
Serve baati with dal and a sweet churma made by crushing baati with ghee and jaggery/sugar
Optional garnish with chopped cilantro and shredded onion pickle on the side

name: Laal Maas
steps: Dry roast spices
Marinate mutton in yogurt, garlic paste and roasted spices
Sauté onions in ghee, add meat and marinade
Slow-cook with water until tender
Finish with a tempering of whole spices in hot ghee

name: Gatte ki Sabzi
steps: Make besan dough and form into dumplings; steam until firm
Prepare yogurt-based gravy with spices
Simmer gatte in gravy until flavorful
Temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves, garlic

name: Ker Sangri
steps: Rehydrate dried ker sangri and karan phali
Temper oil with cumin and garlic
Add onions and spices; add beans and a splash of water
Simmer until tender and tangy; finish with amchur powder

name: Bikaneri Bhujia Kadhi
steps: Whisk yogurt with besan and spices
Cook on medium flame until thick
Prepare tempering with mustard seeds, curry leaves, garlic in oil; pour over kadhi
Simmer briefly and serve

name: Sorsemachi Devilled Fish
ingredients: king fish or any firm white fish
steps: Toast poppy seeds and red chilies, grind with tamarind pulp and garlic to a thick paste
Sauté onions in oil, add curry leaves and turmeric
Stir in ground paste, add fish pieces, splash coconut milk, simmer gently until fish is cooked and flavors meld
Finish with a squeeze of lime and serve with steamed rice

name: Xacuti Garam Goan Curry
steps: Grind roasted spices with coconut into a coarse paste
Temper onions in oil until translucent, add ginger and garlic, then the ground masala
Cook until oil separates, add meat and a little water, simmer slowly until tender
Adjust salt and spice as needed

name: Kombdi Vade with Goan Chilli Gravy
steps: Marinate chicken with chili powder and salt
Fry plantain or rice flour-based vade separately until crisp
Make a spicy gravy by tempering aromatics, adding ground chilies and coriander seeds, then coconut milk and tamarind
Simmer chicken in gravy until tender and serving with hot vades

name: Goan Prawn Caldeen (Caldine)
steps: Sauté onions and garlic until soft, add spices and tomatoes to form a masala
Pour in coconut milk and vinegar, simmer to thicken
Add prawns and kokum, cook until prawns are just opaque
Finish with a splash of water if needed

name: Goan Sol Kadhi with Grilled Fish
steps: Grind garlic, cumin, and chilies; mix with kokum water and coconut milk to make Kadhi
Grill fish with simple salt and pepper, plate with kadhi on the side
Squeeze lemon over fish before serving

name: Xacuti (Goan Chicken Xacuti)
steps: Dry-roast poppy seeds, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, and dried red chilies
Grind with grated coconut, garlic, ginger to a paste
Marinate chicken with turmeric and salt
Temper with bay leaf and cinnamon, then add onion and paste; slow-cook until tender
Finish with a splash of vinegar and cilantro

name: Goan Fish Curry (Mackerel/Kingfish)
steps: Sauté onions with curry leaves; add garlic, ginger, and spices
Pour in coconut milk and tamarind water; simmer
Add fish pieces and cook gently until tender
Finish with salt and a squeeze of lime

name: Goan Prawn Vindaloo
steps: Marinate prawns in vinegar, garlic, and chili paste
Temper spices in oil, add sliced onions, then add marinated prawns with a splash of water
Add diced potatoes and simmer until tender
Adjust salt and tanginess with tamarind

name: Sorpotel (Goan Pork Tapas)
steps: Boil pork and liver until tender, mince finely
Prepare a masala by grinding spices with vinegar
Sauté onions until translucent, add masala paste and cook; fold in minced pork and liver, simmer until flavors meld
Long cooking improves depth

name: Goan Mushroom Xacuti (Vegetarian)
steps: Toast and grind spices with coconut and poppy seeds to a paste
Sauté onions, add ground paste, simmer with mushrooms until gravy thickens
Finish with a touch of vinegar and fresh cilantro

name: Goan Fish Vindaloo
ingredients: ribbon fish (or any firm white fish)
steps: Temper spices in oil: add mustard and cumin seeds, then garlic and onions until translucent
Grind red chilies, coriander seeds, and cumin with a little vinegar to a paste
Add the paste, tamarind, and palm sugar; simmer with fish and a splash of water until the sauce thickens and fish is just cooked
Finish with a splash of vinegar and salt to taste

name: Goan Prawn Xacuti
steps: Roast and grind coconut, poppy seeds, and whole spices into a fine masala
Sauté onions and garlic, add masala paste, and deglaze with a bit of tamarind water
Add prawns and simmer until cooked through
Season with salt and a touch of sugar

name: Goan Chicken Cafreal
steps: Pound chilies, herbs, garlic, and spices to a green paste
Marinate chicken in paste with vinegar and salt for several hours
Pan-fry or grill until cooked through, basting with leftover marinade to intensify flavor

name: Goan Sardine Recheado
steps: Prepare recheado masala by grinding chilies, spices, and garlic with vinegar
Stuff cleaned sardines with masala; seal openings with a toothpick if needed
Pan-fry in oil until crispy and serve with rice or bread

name: Kombdi Vade (Goan Roast Chicken with Vade)
steps: Marinate chicken with salt, turmeric, and tamarind
Grind garlic, ginger, coriander seeds, cumin seeds, and red chilies
Temper in coconut oil with chopped onion
Add marinated chicken and simmer until tender
Separately grind a few spices for a paste and fold into the curry
Add vadé pieces halfway through cooking to soak up flavors
Serve with lemon wedges and fresh cilantro

name: Saunkhache Faa (Goan Palak with Coconut)
steps: Temper mustard seeds in hot oil with cinnamon and cloves
Sauté onion, garlic, and green chilies
Add chopped spinach and a splash of tamarind water
Cook until wilted and well-seasoned
Finish with fresh grated coconut for a creamy finish

name: Xacuti Goan Curry (Chicken or Pork Xacuti)
steps: Toast spices and grind to a coarse powder
Blend with grated coconut to make a thick paste
Temper with onions in oil until translucent
Add meat and tamarind water, simmer slowly until tender
Finish with a splash of coconut milk if desired
Serve with plain rice or neer dosa

name: Carne Vindaloo Goan Style
steps: Marinate meat in vinegar, garlic, and spices for a few hours
Brown meat in oil, then add chopped onions and grind spice paste made with cumin, coriander, and red chilies
Add tamarind water and simmer slowly until meat is tender and sauce thickened
Adjust salt and tanginess with more vinegar or tamarind juice

name: Goan Fish Recheado (Stuffed Fish Goan Style)
steps: Make recheado paste by grinding dried chilies, garlic, tamarind, and spices
Slit fish fillets and stuff with the paste
Pan-fry in oil until the paste forms a crust, then simmer with onion and curry leaves until fish is cooked through
Finish with a drizzle of oil

name: Goan Fish Caldeen
steps: Grind garlic, red chilies, and poppy seeds into a paste
Heat coconut oil, temper mustard seeds, curry leaves, and chopped onion until translucent
Add paste and cook briefly, then stir in tamarind juice and coconut milk
Add fish pieces, simmer gently until cooked through
Finish with a splash of coconut oil and salt to taste

name: Prawn Vindaloo (Goan Style)
steps: Marinate prawns in vinegar, garlic, and spices
Temper cloves, cinnamon, mustard seeds in hot oil
Add onions and curry leaves; cook until soft
Stir in prawns with marinade and a little water; simmer until sauce thickens
Adjust salt and tang with more vinegar if needed

name: Goan Chicken Xacuti
steps: Dry-roast and grind poppy seeds, sesame seeds, coriander, cumin, and chilies
Sauté onions in oil until caramelized
Add ground spice paste with garlic; sauté until fragrant
Add chicken and coat with paste; pour in coconut milk and simmer until tender
Finish with curry leaves

name: Goan Crab Rechado
steps: Sauté onions, garlic, and red chilies in oil
Add crab and stir-fry briefly
Add a paste of grated coconut, vinegar, and tamarind; cook until flavors meld
Finish with chopped coriander and a dash of mustard seeds tempered in oil

name: Goan Poi/Mutton Curry
steps: Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until golden
Add spices and tomatoes; cook until oil separates
Add mutton and brown
Add coconut milk and a little tamarind; simmer until meat is tender
Finish with curry leaves

name: Goan Bebinca (Dessert, Coconut Custard)
steps: Layer a thick pan with melted butter
Alternate layers of a smooth coconut-egg mixture and batter, baking each layer until set
Repeat until the batter is finished to create a multi-layer cake

name: Rogan Josh with Lamb
steps: Marinate lamb in yogurt and Kashmiri chili
Temper with ghee, cumin seeds, and fennel
Slow-cook lamb with onions until tender, add garlic-ginger paste, saffron-infused water, and garam masala
Finish with a drizzle of ghee and simmer until thickened
Rest and serve with steamed rice or naan

name: Mughlai Dum Aloo Kashmiri
steps: Parboil potatoes; prepare a yogurt-based marinade with Kashmiri chili and spices
Fry spice mixture in oil, add potatoes, simmer in thick yogurt gravy with saffron and milk until creamy
Finish with almond paste and a touch of ghee

name: Kashmiri Phirni with Pistachios
steps: Soak ground rice; simmer milk with sugar, cardamom, saffron, and rose water
Add rice paste; simmer until thick
Pour into bowls and chill
Garnish with crushed pistachios and edible silver leaf

name: Kashmiri Rogan-e-Khurchan (Smoked Tomato Curry)
steps: Roast and mash tomatoes
Temper oil with fennel, asafoetida, and garlic-ginger; add chili powder and masalas
Simmer tomato paste, then fold in spiced oil and finish with a touch of fenugreek leaves

name: Rogan Josh Kashmiri Lamb
steps: Marinate lamb in yogurt and Kashmiri chili powder
Temper mustard oil with whole spices (cinnamon, cloves, cardamom)
Sauté onions until golden, add garlic and ginger, then tomatoes
Return meat with marinade, add water, simmer slowly until tender
Finish with crushed fennel, garam masala, and saffron soaked in warm water
Serve with basmati rice or naan

name: Kashmiri Dum Aloo
steps: Deep fry peeled baby potatoes until crisp
Prepare a spiced yogurt gravy with onions, garlic, ginger and Kashmiri red chili
Simmer potatoes in gravy until flavors meld, finish with crushed fennel and garam masala

name: Nadir Yakhni (Yogurt-Scented Fish Stew)
steps: Blanch and marinate fish lightly in yogurt with garlic and ginger
Prepare a pale spiced yogurt sauce with fennel, cardamom, bay leaf and cumin
Simmer fish gently in the sauce until cooked through
Finish with saffron-infused oil

name: Makhani Maalai Rista (Lamb Meatballs in Cream Gravy)
steps: Grind lamb with almonds and poppy seeds to form small meatballs
Brown meatballs in ghee, remove
Prepare a rich gravy with onions, garlic, ginger, and Kashmiri chili
Return meatballs and simmer with cream and saffron until glossy

name: Chaman Kaliya (Paneer in Green Gravy)
steps: Blanch spinach; grind with green chilies and yogurt to make a green gravy
Temper cumin and fennel seeds in ghee, add ground masala, simmer with paneer cubes until heated through
Finish with coriander and nigella seeds

name: Rogan Josh Kashmiri Style
steps: Marinate the meat in yogurt, garlic, ginger and Kashmiri red chili powder
Temper ghee with asafoetida, fennel seeds and whole spices; add onions and sauté until translucent
Add marinated meat, saffron-infused water, and simmer slowly in a heavy pot until tender
Finish with garam masala and a touch of saffron
Rest before serving

name: Chaman Qalai (Kashmiri Paneer with Spinach)
steps: Blanch spinach and puree
Temper mustard oil with garlic, ginger, and green chilies
Add spinach puree, turmeric and salt; fold in paneer cubes and simmer gently
Stir in yogurt at the end to enrich the sauce and finish with kasuri methi

name: Kashmiri Haak with Nadur (Collard Greens with Nettle)
steps: Wash greens thoroughly
Blanch haak and nadur separately
Temper hot mustard oil with garlic, dried chilies and cumin seeds
Add greens, turmeric, salt and a splash of lemon juice; simmer until greens are tender and flavors meld

name: Kashmiri Rogan Gusht (Lamb Curry with Kashmiri Red Chilli)
steps: Sauté onions in ghee until golden
Add garlic and ginger; stir in lamb with Kashmiri red chili powder
Deglaze with yogurt and a little water
Simmer slowly until meat is tender and flavors deepen
Finish with garam masala and a whisper of saffron

name: Noon Chai Infused Lamb Kebabs (Gosht Kebab)
steps: Marinate lamb with spices, garlic, and ginger
Add a splash of cooled noon chai-infused yogurt
Shape into kebabs and grill or pan-sear until lightly charred
Let rest and serve with a tangy yogurt-mint chutney

name: Rogan Josh (Kashmiri Lamb Stew)
steps: Marinate pieces of lamb with yogurt, garlic, salt
Temper with oil, fennel seeds, and Kashmiri red chili powder
Add onions, ginger powder; sauté until translucent
Add lamb and browned
Slow-cook with water until tender
Finish with garam masala, saffron-infused milk, and a splash of rose water
Garnish with toasted almond slivers

name: Yakhni Poultice (Kashmiri Yakhni Chicken)
steps: Pound spices lightly; blend with yogurt to make a thick marinade
Marinate chicken for several hours
Brown onions in ghee, add whole spices
Add marinated chicken and simmer slowly with yogurt sauce until tender
Adjust salt and finish with a little garam masala

name: Kashmiri Dum Aloo
steps: Parboil baby potatoes; lightly crush
Prepare a spice paste with Kashmiri chili, fennel, garlic, ginger
Fry potatoes in mustard oil until golden
Simmer in a tangy yogurt-based curry with saffron and seeds until thickened
Finish with a hint of asafoetida

name: Nadir-E-Khas (Seasoned Fish from Wular Lake)
steps: Marinate fish with turmeric, chili powder, salt
Dust with fennel seeds and mustard oil; shallow-fry until crisp
Prepare a yogurt-based curry with garlic, ginger, green chilies
Add fried fish pieces and simmer briefly to soak flavors
Finish with lemon juice and coriander

name: Rogan Josh (Kashmiri Lamb Curry)
steps: Marinate lamb in yogurt and Kashmiri red chili powder
In a heavy pot, temper mustard oil with fennel seeds and whole spices
Add onions and brown
Stir in ginger and garlic pastes
Add marinated lamb, cover and slow-cook until tender
Finish with garam masala and a pinch of saffron soaked in warm water
Garnish with slivered almonds

name: Dum Aumar (A Gum-free Kashmiri Meat Dum)
steps: Marinate mutton with yogurt, fennel, amchur and rose water
Layer in a heavy pot with fried onions and ghee
Seal and slow-cook on low heat until meat is tender and sauce thickens
Finish with a drizzle of saffron-infused milk

name: Kashmiri Phirni with Saffron
steps: Soak saffron in warm milk
Simmer milk with rice flour until thickened
Sweeten and stir in cardamom
Chill and garnish with saffron threads and chopped almonds

name: Chaman Qahva (Kashmiri Creamy Spinach)
steps: Blanch spinach, puree with garlic
Temper ghee with chili powder and garam masala, add spinach puree
Simmer with yogurt to create a creamy texture
Finish with a touch of fenugreek leaves

name: Rista (Kashmiri Meat Dumplings)
steps: Prepare filling by mixing minced meat with spices and almond paste
Shape into small dumplings and simmer in a tomato-onion gravy infused with fennel and garam masala
Finish with a yogurt drizzle

name: Chao Kun
steps: Make a thick batter and cook on a flat pan with ghee until both sides are golden
Traditional chao kun is served with a dollop of butter and a side of spicy chutney

name: Kashmiri Kahwa Infused Rice Pulao
steps: Rinse rice and parboil
Infuse milk with saffron, then cook rice with whole spices in ghee
Fold in saffron milk and rose petals at the end
Garnish with almonds

name: Galouti Kebab with Hyderabadi influence
steps: Grind spices and papaya to a paste
Mix with minced lamb, onion, garlic, ginger, mint, egg, breadcrumbs; shape into small patties
Pan-fry in ghee until seared and tender, finish with a light braise in saffron-infused stock
Serve with saffron-laced yogurt and naan

name: Mutton Do Pyaza
steps: Brown mutton in ghee; add a generous amount of sliced onions and cook until deeply caramelized
Add garlic, ginger, spices, yogurt, a splash of water; simmer slowly until meat is tender
Finish with almond paste for body

name: Butter Chicken (Mughlai style)
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices; grill briefly
Prepare a rich gravy with tomatoes, cream, butter, and ground nuts; add grilled chicken and simmer until coated in a glossy sauce
Finish with kasuri methi

name: Shahi Korma with Pulao Rice
steps: Toast and grind nuts to a fine paste; brown onions in ghee; add meat with spices and yogurt; slow-cook until tender, then enrich with cream and nut paste
Serve with fluffy basmati pulao scented with saffron

name: Shammi Kebabs (Punjab Mughlai style)
steps: Combine minced meat with spices, chopped onions, chilies, and chickpea flour; form into soft patties
Shallow fry until crisp on the outside and juicy inside; simmer briefly in a light stock to finish

name: Kabuli Pulao with Rogan Jhankh
steps: Wash rice and parboil with whole spices
In a heavy pot, brown onions in ghee, add meat and spices, sear until browned, add yogurt and stock, simmer until meat tender
Layer partially cooked rice over meat, drizzle saffron-infused milk, seal and bake on low heat until fragrant
Fluff and garnish with fried onions and nuts

name: Shahi Butter Chicken Mughlai Style
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt and garam masala overnight
Sauté ginger-garlic in butter, add chicken and sear
Add tomato puree and simmer with cream, finish with ground almonds for richness
Crush kasuri methi and stir in before serving

name: Biryani Mughlai (Seerahi Style)
steps: Marinate meat in yogurt with garam masala
Parboil rice with whole spices
In a heavy pot, layer meat with parboiled rice, top with fried onions, saffron milk, and ghee
Cook on dum until aroma fills kitchen
Rest before serving

name: Nargisi Kofta (Egg Stuffed Lamb Rolls)
steps: Prepare kefta by mixing lamb with spices, wrap around boiled eggs; seal with more meat
Brown in oil, set aside
Prepare gravy using onions, spices, and yogurt, simmer with meat parcels until tender and glossy

name: Mughlai Korma with Fried Nuts
steps: Toast nuts and grind into a paste
Sauté onions in ghee, add spices and meat, degrease with yogurt and nut paste, simmer slowly until meat is tender and sauce coats every piece
Finish with a splash of cream and fried nut garnish

name: Chicken Darbari Korma
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt, garlic-ginger paste and spices
Brown in ghee with whole spices
Add ground cashews and almonds with cream, simmer slowly until tender
Finish with saffron milk and a dash of fried onions
Garnish with kasuri methi and coriander

name: Mughlai Murgh Rezala
steps: Toast poppy seeds and coconut then grind to a paste
Sear chicken in mustard oil, remove
Deglaze pot, add spice paste, yogurt and cream, return chicken, simmer until tender
Finish with lemon juice and coriander

name: Nawabi Biryani with Safran Ghee
steps: Parboil basmati rice with whole spices
Layer meat curry with partially cooked rice, pour saffron-infused ghee over top, seal pot and cook on dum until fragrant
Rest, then fluff and garnish with fried onions, cashews and raisins

name: Shahi Kofta Korma
steps: Prepare kofta by binding minced meat with nuts and bread crumbs; deep fry lightly
Prepare rich gravy with yogurt, cream, and ground nuts; simmer koftas in gravy until melt-in-mouth
Garnish with saffron and nutmeg

name: Paneer Pasanda Mughlai
steps: Sear paneer slices in ghee; prepare creamy gravy with almond paste and yogurt
Simmer paneer in gravy with spices until velvety
Finish with cream and saffron

name: Kebabi Murgh Biryani
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt with garlic-ginger paste, garam masala, and saffron
Parboil basmati rice with bay leaves and whole spices
Layer partially cooked rice with marinated chicken, fried onions, and nut paste; seal pot and slow-cook on dum for 45-60 minutes
Finish with saffron-infused milk and ghee drizzle
Prepare a masala gravy with remaining marination and reduce to coat the chicken

name: Shahi Zalima Qorma
steps: Brown meat with onions in ghee
Prepare a rich gravy by grinding almonds with yogurt and spices; simmer slowly until meat is tender
Finish with a splash of rose water and saffron
Serve with warm naan or rice

name: Mughlai Dum Chicken Kalimirch
steps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, garlic-ginger paste and spices
In a heavy pot, seal with ghee, then slow-cook with a peppercorn-cream gravy until tender
Finish with a drizzle of ghee and fresh coriander

name: Nehari-e-Mughlai with Lamb
steps: Soak and braise lamb with a spiced onion base
Stir in a pasty paste of chickpea flour to thicken, then simmer long hours until the meat is meltingly tender
Finish with garam masala and a squeeze of lemon

name: Korma-e-Alamgir (Alamgir Chicken Korma)
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices
Brown onions in ghee, grind roasted nuts with yogurt to a smooth paste
Temper spices in ghee, add garlic-ginger, then tomato paste
Return chicken, simmer on low with nut paste, cream, and saffron until tender
Finish with rose water and fenugreek leaves

name: Rogan Chicken Mughlai (Shahi Rogan Josh inspired)
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt with spices
Fry onion until deep brown
Grind cashews and poppy seeds with a little yogurt to a paste
Cook chicken in ghee with spice paste, add nut paste, simmer gently with a touch of water until meat is tender
Finish with saffron and garam masala

name: Shahi Paneer Mughlai
steps: Sauté onions in ghee, grind cashews and almonds with yogurt to a paste
Fry spices, add paneer cubes, coat with paste, add cream and saffron, simmer until silky
Finish with kasuri methi and crushed green cardamom

name: Beef Nihari Mughlai Style
ingredients: gabi (dried chickpea flour) or all-purpose flour as thickener
steps: Slow-cook beef with nihari spice mix in ghee for several hours until tender
Stir in flour slurry or chickpea flour to thicken
Add yogurt towards the end and simmer gently
Finish with fresh coriander

name: Mughlai Dum Chicken Biryani
steps: Parboil rice with whole spices
Layer parboiled rice with marinated chicken and fried onions in a heavy pot
Seal the pot and cook on dum until rice is fluffy and chicken tender
Add saffron-infused milk and kewra water at the end

name: Jhinga Mughlai Nawabi Prawn Curry
steps: Marinate prawns in yogurt with spices
Temper whole spices in ghee, add garlic-ginger paste and green chilies
Add prawns with yogurt and coconut, simmer briefly until just cooked
Finish with toasted almond slivers and coriander
